injury.description: Patient fell approximately 8 feet from ladder while at work, resulting in injuries to lower back and left knee
injury.notes: Impact primarily to lower back with secondary injury to left knee from landing

symptoms.description: Sharp, constant pain in lower back, worse with movement
symptoms.additional: Pain radiates down left leg at times

symptoms.description: Dull ache with occasional sharp pain during movement

imaging.findings: No acute fracture. Mild degenerative changes L4-L5
Grade 2 MCL sprain. No meniscal tear

morning.activities:
6:00 AM - Wake up, shower, and get dressed
6:30 AM - Prepare and eat breakfast
7:00 AM - Commute to work
8:00 AM - Start work day

afternoon.activities:
12:00 PM - Lunch break, often including a 15-minute walk
1:00 PM - Resume work tasks
3:00 PM - Gym session or physical activity

evening.activities:
5:00 PM - Commute home
6:00 PM - Prepare and eat dinner
7:00 PM - House chores or errands
9:00 PM - Evening relaxation
10:00 PM - Bedtime routine

weekly.weekdaySchedule: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM standard work hours Monday through Friday. Regular gym sessions Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday mornings.
weekly.weekendSchedule: More flexible schedule, focused on household tasks, family time, and recreational activities. Usually includes longer gym sessions and social events.
weekly.regularActivities:
Gym 3x/week
Weekly family dinner on Sundays
Bi-weekly social outings
Monthly home maintenance
weekly.notes: Maintained consistent work-life balance with regular exercise and social activities

morning.activities:
7:00 AM - Wake up, requires assistance with dressing
7:45 AM - Light breakfast
8:30 AM - Modified work from home

afternoon.activities:
12:00 PM - Rest break and lunch
1:30 PM - Continue modified work
3:00 PM - Physiotherapy exercises

evening.activities:
5:00 PM - Rest period
6:00 PM - Light meal prep with assistance
7:00 PM - Limited household tasks
8:30 PM - Evening routine
9:30 PM - Bed rest

weekly.weekdaySchedule: Modified work schedule from home, 4-hour shifts on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Physiotherapy appointments Tuesday and Thursday mornings.
weekly.weekendSchedule: Rest focused with minimal activities. Light exercises and family visits when energy permits.
weekly.regularActivities:
Physiotherapy 2x/week
Medical appointments
Modified home exercise program
Weekly grocery delivery
weekly.notes: Significantly modified schedule to accommodate pain levels and medical appointments

Standing.limitations: Limited to 15 minutes at a time. Increased pain with prolonged standing, favors right leg
Standing.adaptations: Regular position changes, use of anti-fatigue mat, ability to lean on counters/supports

Walking.limitations: Limited to 10 minutes continuous. Antalgic gait pattern, reduced weight bearing on left leg
Walking.adaptations: Use of walking stick for longer distances, frequent rest breaks

Sitting.limitations: Limited to 30 minutes continuous. Requires frequent position changes
Sitting.adaptations: Ergonomic chair with lumbar support, regular standing breaks

Lifting.limitations: Unable to lift more than 10 lbs from floor level. Pain with bending and lifting motions
Lifting.adaptations: Two-person lift for heavier items, use of mechanical aids, lift from waist height only

Carrying.limitations: Limited to light items only. Difficulty with items over 5 lbs for distances over 10 meters
Carrying.adaptations: Use of cart/trolley for transport, breaking tasks into smaller loads

Pushing/Pulling.limitations: Difficulty with heavy doors and equipment. Limited by back pain and knee instability
Pushing/Pulling.adaptations: Use automatic doors where available, two-handed techniques, pushing preferred over pulling

Climbing.limitations: Significant difficulty with stairs, especially descending. Limited by knee pain and instability
Climbing.adaptations: Use elevator when available, one step at a time with handrail support

Balancing.limitations: Mild difficulty on uneven surfaces. Increased instability with left knee
Balancing.adaptations: Use of handrails where available, supportive footwear, careful attention to surface conditions

Stooping.limitations: Significant difficulty bending forward. Limited by low back pain
Stooping.adaptations: Use of grabber tool, knee bend instead of waist bend when possible, raise work height

Kneeling.limitations: Unable to kneel on left knee, limited on right. Pain in both knees with pressure
Kneeling.adaptations: Use of kneeling pad when necessary, alternative positions such as squatting or sitting

Crouching.limitations: Limited ability to maintain squatting position. Pain in knees and low back
Crouching.adaptations: Use of low stool or chair instead of crouching, reorganize work areas to avoid low positions

Reaching.limitations: Overhead reaching increases back pain. Difficulty with sustained reaching
Reaching.adaptations: Use of step stool to bring items closer, rearrangement of commonly used items to waist height

Handling.limitations: Mild difficulty with larger objects. Some limitation with grip strength
Handling.adaptations: Two-handed techniques for heavier items, use of grip aids when needed

Fingering.limitations: Minimal limitations with fine motor tasks. Occasional stiffness
Fingering.adaptations: Regular stretching breaks, ergonomic tools when available

Feeling.limitations: Minimal limitations with tactile tasks. No significant impairment

functionalAssessment.overallNotes: Patient demonstrates significant functional limitations in most physical activities, particularly those involving the lower back and left knee. Work and home modifications are currently required for most activities of daily living.
recommendations: Implement regular position changes every 30 minutes
Use assistive devices for prolonged walking
Consider workplace modifications for essential tasks
functionalAssessment.followUpNotes: Monitor progress with physiotherapy and reassess work tolerances
